body:
I have a Spack environment (with view).  I did the command:
```
spack install py-tables
```
It came back to me with:
```
==> Successfully installed py-tables
  Fetch: 0.70s.  Build: 2m 12.17s.  Total: 2m 12.88s.
[+] /root/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/gcc-7.4.0/py-tables-3.4.4-gxdk7c5kh3bgbwcjeqwidzifqsfvch2l

==> Updating view at /root/spack/var/spack/environments/research/.spack-env/view
==> Error: Cannot deactivate r-rcppeigen@0.3.3.3.1%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/76ff53y because r-car@2.1-4%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64/7kucd5b is activated and depends on it
```
Yes, I have a bunch of R stuff in the environment.  But why is it trying to deactivate / reactive R things when all I did was add `py-tables`?
title: Spurious Error Installing into Environment w/ View
